title: Winner Take 'W'ALL Of It
body_text:
EVENT BACKGROUND
WINNER TAKE WALL was the astounding 197th
East Coast Dodgeball
event produced within the Tronolone Era. The makings of the encounter came immediately following the conclusion of the previous event, WALKING DEAD.
MAIN EVENT HYPE
The event subtitle gave plenty of indication that the massive rivaling factions
WALL and ALL
would indeed clash again. Prior to WINNER TAKE WALL, the dualing armies had competed a total of twelve times, with the hometown Wall Knights capturing eight victories to ALL's four.
Promotional posters and online articles slated this 197th
ECD
spectacle to be the 13th - and supposed final - collision between Wall and All. More specifically, the Knights had
never
defeated the unwelcomed visitors three consecutive occasions in the historic series; All somehow managed to recoup after a pair of setbacks.
WALL v. ALL 13
With a three lead changes, a crucial one-on-one showdown, and the stellar line-up that comprised each army, there isn't any doubt that "WA13" produced the greatest battle in this heated war story.
Through the first six rounds, the score was at a deadlocked 3. Fitzpatrick, Edwards, Tronolone, Adams, Megill, Pierce, Wolf, among others refused the raise the dreaded white flag.
Then, in the series' most pivotal moment, the lucky 7th pitted two long-time veterans in a last man standing showdown for personal pride and team bragging rights: Kevin Megill against Justin Wolf. Trust that it wasn't an easy task for either
ECDElitist
to eliminate the other. The southpaw Megill had even begun throwing at near full-speed, a site not witnessed since before his unfortunate shoulder injury in September 2010. The hungry Wolf wouldn't show any remorse, and after a nail-biting battle, the 2011 Hall Of Fame inductee's bulletball was the final blow. Wall had regained the advantage and, despite an incredible effort by their opposition, never relinquished the lead.
WALL: 1, 3, 6, 7, 9, 11
(6)
ALL: 2, 4, 5, 8, 10
(5)
RECORDS & AFTERMATH
◘ Attendance for WINNER TAKE WALL was a
seventeen (17)
strong. Two new competitors were included in the turnout: Katrina Petrovich and Samuel Moss.
◘ Because of the Megill-Wolf showdown, both men have agreed to face in a one-on-one captains confrontation at the next
ECD
presentation, MAYN EVENT. Shockingly,
CREAMation Rules
will be in effect.
body_html:
EVENT BACKGROUND
WINNER TAKE WALL was the astounding 197th East Coast Dodgeball event produced within the Tronolone Era. The makings of the encounter came immediately following the conclusion of the previous event, WALKING DEAD.

MAIN EVENT HYPE
The event subtitle gave plenty of indication that the massive rivaling factions WALL and ALL would indeed clash again. Prior to WINNER TAKE WALL, the dualing armies had competed a total of twelve times, with the hometown Wall Knights capturing eight victories to ALL's four.

Promotional posters and online articles slated this 197th ECD spectacle to be the 13th - and supposed final - collision between Wall and All. More specifically, the Knights had never defeated the unwelcomed visitors three consecutive occasions in the historic series; All somehow managed to recoup after a pair of setbacks.

WALL v. ALL 13
With a three lead changes, a crucial one-on-one showdown, and the stellar line-up that comprised each army, there isn't any doubt that "WA13" produced the greatest battle in this heated war story.

Through the first six rounds, the score was at a deadlocked 3. Fitzpatrick, Edwards, Tronolone, Adams, Megill, Pierce, Wolf, among others refused the raise the dreaded white flag.

Then, in the series' most pivotal moment, the lucky 7th pitted two long-time veterans in a last man standing showdown for personal pride and team bragging rights: Kevin Megill against Justin Wolf. Trust that it wasn't an easy task for either ECDElitist to eliminate the other. The southpaw Megill had even begun throwing at near full-speed, a site not witnessed since before his unfortunate shoulder injury in September 2010. The hungry Wolf wouldn't show any remorse, and after a nail-biting battle, the 2011 Hall Of Fame inductee's bulletball was the final blow. Wall had regained the advantage and, despite an incredible effort by their opposition, never relinquished the lead.

WALL: 1, 3, 6, 7, 9, 11 (6)
ALL: 2, 4, 5, 8, 10 (5)

RECORDS & AFTERMATH
◘ Attendance for WINNER TAKE WALL was a seventeen (17) strong. Two new competitors were included in the turnout: Katrina Petrovich and Samuel Moss.
◘ Because of the Megill-Wolf showdown, both men have agreed to face in a one-on-one captains confrontation at the next ECD presentation, MAYN EVENT. Shockingly, CREAMation Rules will be in effect.
